tweets.text: Research by experts @EngineeringNCL & @NorthumbrianH2O to identify traces of Covid-19 in sewage is helping to give early warning of local outbreaks & supporting public health teams   https://t.co/r3mcQP3ny4 @EnvAgencyYNE

@CossieRob @EnvAgency Eventually? So until we have a reliable test we just lock people up? It‚Äôs currently ‚Äòillegal‚Äô for me to visit my friends or family, based on a faulty test. Forgive me for being willing to wait for a reliable test.

tweets.text:
The UK has made a breakthrough in using science to tackle #coronavirus.  

Scientists can now use sewage to detect local outbreaks, even when people don't show symptoms.  

Find out more: https://t.co/JEJxbjIMR0 

#CovidSewageTesting @DHSCgovuk @EnvAgency https://t.co/vW5ratcTmN
@DrGonzo1985 @EnvAgency Apply that globally. Refined validation of testing will increase reliability. Eventually reliable methods will be developed.

tweets.text:
There has been a sharp rise in serious breaches of environmental rules designed to protect people and wildlife from pollution.

Me and @annalom87 have been digging through the data on pollution regulation, you can read our exclusive investigation below üëá

https://t.co/SNJPvK3eUe

@ADA_updates Has anything been done to rectify the flooding problems in Nottinghamshire & South Yorkshire along the River Idle before high water season arrives? Do we have to endure another year of flooded properties & farmland?

@waterlevels @IDBsomerset Good to see Phil. If you make sure they return next summer to manually remove the small remnants which there will undoubtedly be, you can conquer it. @EnvAgency did this on the Thames a couple of years ago and it‚Äôs now much easier to clear any reappearance each year.

tweets.text: Our lab in Starcross is doing the testing and samples in the South West are coming in from Bristol, Plymouth, St Ives, Trowbridge and Weymouth #CovidSewageTesting https://t.co/Zu95FLX1Xd

We‚Äôre so happy, our second NATIONAL NATURE RESERVE, well done and thank you to everyone who helped to make this happen @FriendsofSaltwellsNatureReserve @NE_WestMids @canalrivertrust @EnvAgencyMids
 and our amazing volunteers. 
WE DID IT, THANK YOU!!!!! Here's our best bits! https://t.co/UKkbTc2NjZ

Big HELLO to our new followers, a great page for you to visit is this one ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/dRB4mv4V4X . It's a collection of videos that cover pretty much everything we do. #slowtheflow #aboutus  @CalderdaleFound @Calderdale @EnvAgencyYNE @HardcastleNT

urls.title: Slowing The Flow Together - Slow The Flow
urls.description: Slowing the Flow Together virtual event 3rd June 7.30pm on Zoom. A chance to see how flood risk has been reduced in Calderdale using natural methods.

tweets.text: Parrett IDB clearing a highly invasive non-native plant, Floating pennywort, from Damas Rhyne on Langmead Level. Operation undertaken with careful biosecurity, machine cleaned before and after, to prevent contamination of other areas. Top job @IDBsomerset https://t.co/SjOKfTKnZK
@WBMCarpFishing @simongarrard2 @EnvAgency https://t.co/XINq6qdTFB
@SeanSpe85096058 @simongarrard2 @EnvAgency No I haven‚Äôt mate have u got a link to it please?
@buttery_simon @GroundControlGC @EnvAgency Stunning photos!
@SeanSpe85096058 @WBMCarpFishing @EnvAgency It's nothing but a tax on anglers , has been for years . Ea no doubt squander it .
@simongarrard2 @WBMCarpFishing @EnvAgency Have you read the article from John Bailey I was talking about very interesting pal
Early start for weed cutting in Leigh on the Pennington Brook for @GroundControlGC on the @EnvAgency contract. Not a bad view this morning #rainbowsandexcavators https://t.co/MZjqpHJBsU
@CossieRob @EnvAgency Fair point. Can‚Äôt agreed with you on it but thank you for the input ‚úåüèª This just reeks of desperation on the governments part to keep the narrative going.

tweets.text: We did it! Saltwells is now a NATIONAL NATURE RESERVE!!!! Thank you @NE_WestMids! @unescouk @BCgeopark  #saltwellsnnr #geology @BritGeoSurvey @geolsoc @BCGeoSoc  @GeolAssoc @discoverdudley @envagency @CRTWestMidlands @TonyJuniper @themjcouk @lgcplus @EnvAgencyMids @DudleyNature https://t.co/woocz6aPWZ

tweets.text: @DrGonzo1985 @EnvAgency But if you have it showing up at the treatment works, maybe even the network, before any reported cases, it‚Äôs an early warning sign. It wouldn‚Äôt be used to lockdown anyone as other indications would be evident and drive tougher measures.
@CossieRob @EnvAgency But there‚Äôs no way of knowing where the infection came from so they‚Äôd still be imposing lockdowns on people unjustly.
@DrGonzo1985 @EnvAgency It‚Äôs an early warning sign. Like how analysing sewage can tell you what drugs the population take.

@SarahKHolford @SE_Rivers_Trust @WandleForum @thameswater @Wandle_Trust @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency We've just launched this action for the Hogsmill https://t.co/pp3cUKl2jj, following on from the Thames earlier in the week. It includes the Wandle (and Beverley Brook). 
We want to see real-time sewer spill alerts so we know exactly what's going on, in public.

tweets.text:
All a bit odd. 1 year after your director of ops joins the board of a water industry lobbying org and a month before he jumps ship to a commercial rival you finally advertise his job.

Presume he did work his notice period / gardening leave?

Or just more @EnvAgency incompetence? https://t.co/56elMiDH1m

Nobody wants to see such antisocial and selfish acts in our communities.

We will not tolerate fly-tipping, we will enforce. We issued 29 fixed penalty notices to perpetrators in September alone.

Please help us by reporting. Visit https://t.co/ztNXlo3NLx for ways to report. https://t.co/L98WBbX7Ai

We had reports of a swan stuck in Stallingtons Clyce near Combwich, the Parrett Field Team have attended site on the high tide and I can confirm the Swan is now free. @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/AQEEE7Lod8

tweets.text: Don‚Äôt miss our webinar on Estuary Edges- replacing traditional tidal walls with a variety of habitats. Next Weds at 11am #LRW2020 https://t.co/b8T2dBpQ69

The #SLWP Beddington Incinerator üè≠ continues to breach the @EnvAgency permit. 

üì∞Report just published shows: On 4th Oct that the CO Carbon Monoxide went over the permitted limit with a reading as high as 4161mg/m3!

Turning it off for the rest of day went over daily average. https://t.co/1PeRqFxpuE

tweets.text:
Water companies are proud to be part of this project & are providing #wastewater samples to help detect local outbreaks.

We will continue to do everything we can to fight #COVID19 & help keep our customers, & the communities we serve, safe.

@EnvAgency 

https://t.co/IS8GZRhQ5D https://t.co/GfdIelCkIk

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency More incompetence üòÇ

tweets.text: Our trainee firefighters from Course 5/20, after their first week of hose and pumps, have put their new skills to the test during a water relay exercise. Massive thanks to @EnvAgency Lea Marsten site for their support of the event. @WestMidsFire @jimrott8365 https://t.co/bVXPgW8qSg
The @EnvAgency Fisheries Enforcement Officers have seized an illegal fishing net at Skinningrove in Redcar and Cleveland. Read a piece in @TeessideLive https://t.co/esbkUzDb3s

Despite a challenging year, barriers to fish migration are still being tackled. Slitting Mill weir has been removed as part of the HLF Hidden Rivers Secret Streams project, led by Don Catchment Rivers Trust. This area of the project was funded via the Rotherham Rivers ll project. https://t.co/f2LM0VK5ug
